1: %% Tests for the `erl -S httpd serve` functionality.
    2: -module(httpd_serve_SUITE).
    3: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0]).
    4: -export([
    5:     argless_start/1,
    6:     argless_serve/1,
    7:     simple_random_port_serve/1,
    8:     serve_on_all_interfaces_v4/1,
    9:     serve_on_localhost_v4/1,
   10:     serve_on_all_interfaces_v6/1,
   11:     serve_on_localhost_v6/1,
   12:     serve_custom_directory/1
   13: ]).
   14: 
   15: %% When starting up servers for tests, these variables define how long to
   16: %% wait for the server to report that it has started up, and after how
   17: %% many retries to quit waiting for its report altogether.
   18: -define(STARTUP_WAIT_NAPTIME_MS, 20).
   19: -define(STARTUP_WAIT_RETRIES, 100).
   20: 
   21: %% Default assertions to run in all tests.
   22: -define(DEFAULT_ASSERTIONS, [directory_index, random_file]).
   23: 
   24: suite() ->
   25:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]},
   26:      {timetrap, {seconds, 30}}].
   27: 
   28: all() ->
   29:     [{group, httpd_serve_on_default_port},
   30:      {group, httpd_serve_on_random_ports}].
   31: 
   32: groups() ->
   33:     [{httpd_serve_on_default_port, [sequence], [
   34:         argless_serve,
   35:         argless_start]},
   36:      {httpd_serve_on_random_ports, [parallel], [
   37:         simple_random_port_serve,
   38:         serve_on_all_interfaces_v4,
   39:         serve_on_localhost_v4,
   40:         serve_on_all_interfaces_v6,
   41:         serve_on_localhost_v6,
   42:         serve_custom_directory
   43:       ]}].
   44: 
   45: %%
   46: %% Test cases
   47: %%
   48: 
   49: %% Fixed ports (must be run one at a time)
   50: 
   51: argless_start(_Config) ->
   52:     ServerFun = fun () -> httpd:start([]) end,
   53:     verify_server(ServerFun).
   54: 
   55: argless_serve(_Config) ->
   56:     ServerFun = fun () -> httpd:serve([]) end,
   57:     verify_server(ServerFun).
   58: 
   59: %% Random ports (can run in parallel)
   60: 
   61: simple_random_port_serve(Config) ->
   62:     verify_server(["--port", "0", suite_data(Config)]).
   63: 
   64: serve_on_all_interfaces_v4(Config) ->
   65:     verify_server(["--port", "0", "--bind", "0.0.0.0", suite_data(Config)]).
   66: 
   67: serve_on_localhost_v4(Config) ->
   68:     verify_server(["--port", "0", "--bind", "127.0.0.1", suite_data(Config)]).
   69: 
   70: serve_on_all_interfaces_v6(Config) ->
   71:     verify_server(["--port", "0", "--bind", "::", suite_data(Config)]).
   72: 
   73: serve_on_localhost_v6(Config) ->
   74:     verify_server(["--port", "0", "--bind", "::1", suite_data(Config)]).
   75: 
   76: serve_custom_directory(Config) ->
   77:     SuiteData = suite_data(Config),
   78:     verify_server(["--port", "0", filename:join(SuiteData, "subdir")]).
   79: 
   80: %%
   81: %% Assertion functions
   82: %%
   83: 
   84: %% Assert that the server responds properly.
   85: run_server_assertions(Response) ->
   86:     run_server_assertions(Response, ?DEFAULT_ASSERTIONS).
   87: 
   88: %% Assert that the server responds properly.
   89: run_server_assertions({ok, {Ip0, Port, Path}}, Assertions) when is_integer(Port) ->
   90:     Ip = maybe_convert_to_localhost(Ip0),
   91:     % From the `filelib:wildcard/1` docs:
   92:     % "Directory separators must always be written as /, even on Windows."
   93:     IpToRequest = case Ip of
   94:         {_, _, _, _} -> inet:ntoa(Ip);
   95:         {_, _, _, _, _, _, _, _} -> "[" ++ inet:ntoa(Ip) ++ "]"
   96:     end,
   97: 
   98:     ct:log("Validating custom assertions"),
   99:     DirectoryUrl = "http://" ++ IpToRequest ++ ":" ++ integer_to_list(Port) ++ "/",
  100:     ServerInfo = #{
  101:         url => DirectoryUrl,
  102:         bind_ip => Ip,
  103:         path => Path
  104:     },
  105:     ok = verify_assertions(Assertions, ServerInfo),
  106:     ct:comment("Ran ~w assertion(s).", [length(Assertions)]).
  107: 
  108: maybe_convert_to_localhost(Ip) ->
  109:     case os:type() of
  110:         {unix, linux} -> Ip;
  111:         _Other -> convert_to_localhost(Ip)
  112:     end.
  113: 
  114: convert_to_localhost({0, 0, 0, 0}) ->
  115:     {127, 0, 0, 1};
  116: convert_to_localhost({0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}) ->
  117:     {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1};
  118: convert_to_localhost(Ip) ->
  119:     Ip.
  120: 
  121: %%
  122: %% Assertion helper functions
  123: %%
  124: 
  125: verify_200_at(Url) ->
  126:     HttpcOpts = [{socket_opts, [{ipfamily, inet6fb4}]}],
  127:     Request = {Url, []},
  128:     Response = httpc:request(get, Request, [], HttpcOpts),
  129:     case Response of
  130:         {ok, {{_Version, 200, _}, _Headers, _Body}} ->
  131:             Response;
  132:         {error, {failed_connect, [{to_address, {"::", _Port}},
  133:                                   {inet6, [inet6], eaddrnotavail},
  134:                                   {inet, [inet], nxdomain}]}} ->
  135:             % In this case we could bind on all IPv6 interfaces (::) just
  136:             % fine, but could not issue requests to it due to an OS error.
  137:             % Write it off as a networking misconfiguration and skip.
  138:             exit({skip, "Could not reach host on IPv6 address ::"})
  139:     end.
  140: 
  141: verify_assertions([], _ServerInfo) ->
  142:     ok;
  143: 
  144: verify_assertions([directory_index | Assertions], #{url := Url} = ServerInfo) ->
  145:     ct:log("Validating directory index at ~s", [Url]),
  146:     verify_200_at(Url),
  147:     ct:log("Directory index received with a 200"),
  148:     verify_assertions(Assertions, ServerInfo);
  149: 
  150: verify_assertions([random_file | Assertions],  #{url := Url, path := Path} = ServerInfo) ->
  151:     Files = filelib:wildcard(Path ++ "/*"),
  152:     File = lists:nth(rand:uniform(length(Files)), Files),
  153:     Basename = filename:basename(File),
  154:     FileUrl = Url ++ Basename,
  155:     ct:log("Validating random file at ~s", [FileUrl]),
  156:     verify_200_at(FileUrl),
  157:     ct:log("File received with a 200"),
  158:     verify_assertions(Assertions, ServerInfo).
  159: 
  160: %%
  161: %% Helper functions
  162: %%
  163: 
  164: suite_data(Config) ->
  165:     proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config).
  166: 
  167: verify_server(FunOrArgs) ->
  168:     TestFun = fun run_server_assertions/1,
  169:     with_server(FunOrArgs, TestFun).
  170: 
  171: with_server(Args, TestFun) when is_list(Args) ->
  172:     ServerFun = fun () -> httpd:serve(Args) end,
  173:     run_with_server(ServerFun, TestFun);
  174: 
  175: with_server(ServerFun, TestFun) when is_function(ServerFun) ->
  176:     run_with_server(ServerFun, TestFun).
  177: 
  178: run_with_server(ServerFun, TestFun) ->
  179:     ct:log("Starting server"),
  180:     ct:capture_start(),
  181:     {Child, _Reference} = spawn_monitor(ServerFun),
  182:     StartupResult = wait_for_startup_line(?STARTUP_WAIT_RETRIES),
  183:     ct:capture_stop(),
  184:     {ok, Line} = StartupResult,
  185:     Parsed = parse_startup_line(Line),
  186:     ct:log("Running test function"),
  187:     Result = TestFun(Parsed),
  188:     ct:log("Test function finished, shutting down server"),
  189:     Child ! {self(), shutdown},
  190:     receive done -> ok after 5000 -> ct:fail("No server shutdown after 5s") end,
  191:     ct:log("Server stopped"),
  192:     Result.
  193: 
  194: %% Wait for `ct:capture_get' to give us the output we're looking for.
  195: wait_for_startup_line(Tries) ->
  196:     wait_for_startup_line([], [], Tries).
  197: 
  198: wait_for_startup_line([], [], 0) ->
  199:     {error, no_output_at_all};
  200: wait_for_startup_line([], Unexpected, 0) ->
  201:     {error, {no_startup_line, unexpected_output, Unexpected}};
  202: wait_for_startup_line([], Unexpected, Tries) when Tries > 0 ->
  203:     receive
  204:         {'DOWN', _Reference, process, _Child, Info} ->
  205:             case Info of
  206:                 {{badmatch, {error, {listen, eaddrnotavail}}}, _} ->
  207:                     exit({skip, "Adress not available to listen"});
  208:                 _ ->
  209:                     ct:fail("Child process has died: ~w", [Info])
  210:             end
  211:     after 
  212:         0 -> ok
  213:     end,
  214:     timer:sleep(?STARTUP_WAIT_NAPTIME_MS),
  215:     wait_for_startup_line(ct:capture_get(), Unexpected, Tries - 1);
  216: wait_for_startup_line(["Started HTTP" ++ _Rest = Line | _Lines], _Unexpected, _Tries) ->
  217:     {ok, Line};
  218: wait_for_startup_line([Line | Lines], Unexpected, Tries) ->
  219:     wait_for_startup_line(Lines, [Line | Unexpected], Tries).
  220: 
  221: %% Parse the given line into a tuple.
  222: %% Example line:
  223: %%   Started HTTP server on http://127.0.0.1:8000 at /path/to/lib/inets/make_test_dir/ct_logs/ct_run.test_server@zulu.2023-06-06_12.07.27\n"
  224: parse_startup_line(Line) ->
  225:     {match, [_, RawIp, RawPort, Path]} = re:run(
  226:         Line, "^Started HTTP server on http://(.+):(\\d+) at (.*)\\n$", [{capture, all, list}]
  227:     ),
  228:     {ok, Ip} = inet:parse_address(RawIp),
  229:     Port = list_to_integer(RawPort),
  230:     {ok, {Ip, Port, Path}}.
